page.title: 14UPTON VILLAGE
page.content:
The sub postmistress at Upton used to have an ice cream caravan at Wimbleball Lake but gave it up because it was just too expensive. She had to tow the caravan there every day and after paying the rates for hire of the site and the petrol there was little left. She once spent a whole afternoon there and only took 27p!
There have been quite a few changes in the area over the last 50 years. Many of the old people have moved away to old peoples homes to be replaced by people new to the village - foreigners according to the locals! There used to be a village school but this was closed over ten years ago and now children have to go by bus to schools in Wiveliscombe or Bampton.
